intro: Machaeranthera sessiliflora, commonly known as the prairie blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Machaeranthera sessiliflora is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
